item.description:
Doors open at 5:00 pm for this General Admission performance. It's quite cute, where people are handed out paragraphs to read, either supporting the Patriots or Tories, discussing the stamp tax and tea taxes. Lots of elementary school kids trying to read the words aloud. It's a hoot!

I was thinking we could each pick up our Will Call tickets, then gather near the Coffee Bar at Borders across the street from 4:30 pm to 4:45 pm, then join the immense line forming in front of the Old South Meeting House. The doors open at 5:00 pm.

From Brown Paper Tickets email:

"Purchased tickets will be available at the Old South Meeting House Museum Shop as follows:

"Friday, December 11: 10am-4 pm
"Saturday, December 12: 10 am-4pm
"and Sunday, December 13: 10 am - 5 pm

"Tickets MUST be picked up at the Will Call table by 5 pm on the day of the event.

"Ticketholders arriving after the 5:30 pm program start time will be admitted at the discretion of Old South Meeting House staff and may not be admitted if the event is already at capacity.

"All seating is general admission. Limited handicapped accessible seating is available. If you need assistance, please check in with our staff when you arrive




From the Old South Meeting House site:
http://www.oldsouthme...

"Boston Tea Party Reenactment- Tickets on Sale Now!

"Old South Meeting House presents The 236th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment

"Sunday, December 13, 2009, at 5:30 pm at Old South Meeting House

"Be part of history at the meeting that protested a tax and started a revolution. Join in with Samuel Adams, Paul Revere and throngs of colonists resolved to send the tea ships back to England!

"Then witness the destruction of the tea as you are transported back in time to Boston Harbor on that moonlit night of December 16, 1773.

"The Boston Tea Party ended in Boston Harbor, but it all started here! Old South Meeting House— steeped in history!

"Tickets are $8 each. Ticket sales begin Thursday, October 15 online at www.oldsouthmeetinghouse.org or by phone at (800) 838-3006. Ticket sales are non-refundable.

"Buy early and save $1 per ticket! A limited number of discounted tickets are available—online sales only!

"Space is very limited and this event may sell out. Purchase your tickets early to avoid disappointment".

Where to Meet:

This event gets very, very, very crowded. Everyone and their brother brings their children to this event, we found out last year, and we all couldn't manage to sit together it was so crowded. Let's meet up from 4:30 pm to 4:45 pm across the street at Borders Bookstore in the lobby near the cafe. We can head over and join the immense line at 4:45 pm as a group. Doors open at 5:00 pm.

T.J. Maher is 5 foot 7, with short brown hair, blue eyes, a "Hello My Name is T.J." nametag, and a red MEETUP sign attached to his black messenger bag.
item.name: 236th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment @ Old South Meeting House
